<p>1. django-admin.py startproject mysite (If this is a new project)</p>
<p>2. python manage.py startapp myobj</p>
<p>3. Edit the 'urls.py'</p>
{{{
from django.conf.urls.defaults import patterns, include
from myobj import conf as MYCONF
# Uncomment the next two lines to enable the admin:
from django.contrib import admin
admin.autodiscover()

urlpatterns = patterns('',
    (r'^' + MYCONF.NAVENTRY, include('mysite.myobj.urls')), # /ru/1 or /1, '1' - obj nav
    (r'^admin/myobj/', include('mysite.myobj.urls')),
    
    (r'^admin/', include(admin.site.urls)),
)
}}}
The entry point (MYCONF.NAVENTRY) may be empty or edited, by default, 'ru'
<p>4. copy the files in the project</p>
<p>5. Edit the 'settings.py'. Add 'mysite.myobj' to the INSTALLED_APPS list</p>
<p>6. python manage.py syncdb</p>
<p>7. go http://sitename/admin/myobj/uobjects/class/menu_system (or /admin/myobj/uclasses/install), and click install</p>
